channel.title: EarShot: Must listen audio from the best storytellers on the internet
channel.description: EarShot: Must listen audio from the best storytellers on the internet

item.title: Song Exploder | Sylvan Esso
item.description:
Song Exploder | Sylvan Esso

Sylvan Esso has two members, Amelia Meath and Nick Sanborn, who met while they were both working on other projects. Amelia asked Nick to do a remix of a song by the band she was in at the time, and when that remix was done, they both loved how it turned out.

item.title: Patient Zero - Updated
item.description:
Patient Zero - Updated

The greatest mysteries have a shadowy figure at the center-someone who sets things in motion and holds the key to how the story unfolds-Patient Zero. This hour, Radiolab hunts for Patient Zeroes of all kinds and considers the course of an ongoing outbreak.

item.title: Monday Earshots
item.description:
Monday Earshots

Get one of my favorite episodes every monday morning, via email. You can sign up below.

item.title: 293: A Little Bit of Knowledge
item.description:
293: A Little Bit of Knowledge

Stories about the pitfalls of knowing just a little bit too little. Host Ira Glass describes the thing that we all do at some point: Talk expertly about something we don't actually know anything about. It's so common, explains This American Life contributing editor Nancy Updike, that some friends of hers invented an imaginary magazine devoted to such blathering.

item.title: Song Exploder | Episode 1: The Postal Service
item.description:
Song Exploder | Episode 1: The Postal Service

"The District Sleeps Alone Tonight" DOWNLOAD: iTUNES Â· MP3 Our first guest on Song Exploder is Jimmy Tamborello, aka Dntel, aka one half of The Postal Service (the other half being Ben Gibbard of Death Cab for Cutie). Jimmy breaks down "The District Sleeps Alone Tonight," and talks about his instruments, his influences, and how ...

item.title: The Living Room
item.description:
The Living Room

Diane Weipert - Voyeur Diane's new neighbors across the way never shut their curtains, and that was the beginning of an intimate, but very one-sided relationship. Diane Weipert is a writer and filmmaker. Produced by Briana Breen.

item.title: Song Exploder | Game of Thrones
item.description:
Song Exploder | Game of Thrones

"Game of Thrones (Main Title Theme)" Game of Thrones premiered on HBO in April 2011 and became the most watched show in HBO's history. The main title theme was written by Emmy-nominated composer Ramin Djawadi. In this episode, he'll break down the different elements in the piece, and how themes within the show inspired his composition and choice of instruments.

item.title: Miss Manhattan - 99% Invisible
item.description:
Miss Manhattan - 99% Invisible

All over New York City, there is a woman in various states of undress, so baked into architecture that we barely even notice her.
